titleStmt.title: More work for George Keith being Geroge Keith's vindication of the people called Quakers as well in his part of the dispute held at Wheelers-Street the 16th day of the 8th month, 1674. As in his treatise against Thomas Hicks, and other Baptists, with the rest of their confederate brethren at the Barbican dispute, held at London the 28th of the 6th month, 1674.
titleStmt.author: Penn, William, 1644-1718.

Keith, George, 1639?-1716. Vindication from the forgeries and abuses of T. Hicks, and W. Kiffin, with the rest of his confederate brethren of the Barbican-meeting, held at London the 28th of the 6th month, 1674. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: printed and sold by T. Sowle near the Meeting-House in VVhite-Hart-Court in Gracious-street,

notesStmt.note: Caption title on p. 1 reads: "See brief narrative, of the meeting at Wheelers-Street, &c. Published by W. Mead, and others, printed 1674. beginning at page 46"; caption title on p. 24 reads: "George Keith's vindication from the forgeries and abuses of T. Hicks, and W. Kiffin, with the rest of his confederate brethren of the Barbican-meeting, held at London the 28th of the 6th month, 1674", and is signed: George Keith.
Reproduction of the original in the Friends House Library, London.
